sentences.english: No one fainted at the sight of the aircraft being trafficked onto the runway.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一個人因爲看到飛機在跑道上交易時而昏厥。

sentences.english: Long QT syndrome speeds up heartbeats, and can cause fainting.
sentences.chinese: QT間期延長綜合症會加速心跳，導致昏厥。

sentences.english: Objective: The susceptibility to suffer neurally mediated syncope and loss of consciousness varies markedly.
sentences.chinese: 昏厥和失去意識的敏感性變化很大。

sentences.english: An interrogator clutched one detainee's neck so that he repeatedly passed out.
sentences.chinese: 一審訊官緊緊掐住一囚犯的脖子以致他幾次昏厥過去。

sentences.english: A tingling sensation in his arm told him that he had blacked out for a while.
sentences.chinese: 手臂上有點刺痛，他明白自己曾昏厥了片刻。
包括醫生們也昏厥過去了。

sentences.english: An interrogator clutched one detainee’s neck so that he repeatedly passed out.
sentences.chinese: 一審訊官緊緊掐住一囚犯的脖子以致他幾次昏厥過去。

sentences.english: We all remember when the obligation to donate blood to go to college, he had lost consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 我們都記得上大學時義務獻血，他曾經昏厥過去。

sentences.english: I didn’t tell her that swooning was equally cathartic.
sentences.chinese: 我沒告訴她其實昏厥就跟瀉藥一樣。

sentences.english: John reportedly passed out during sparring as a result of some kind of blood disorder.
sentences.chinese: 據說，約翰因某種血液問題，在對練中昏厥。

sentences.english: The woman serving tea in the conference room almost fainted at the spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 房間裏倒茶的女服務生看到這一景象幾乎昏厥過去。

sentences.english: Perhaps girls from non-western countries swoon over them.
sentences.chinese: 來自非西方國家的女孩，也許在他們昏厥。

definition: to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to be delirious/to be mentally confused
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
to faint from fear/to be frightened into fits/shell-shocked
